data.title: Loader: PDF. Att: Flora Bela currículo 911570512
data.description:
We are analyzing the Phishing Threat Monitoring Item number #87152 within this case.

Further updates will be posted within this case as they become available.



====================================================





We reviewed an email submitted for analysis by Universal Music Group. This email contained a link pointing to a malicious web page. When the user clicks on this page, a ZIP archive is downloaded. Once the user opens the ZIP archive and executes the Windows Executable, the victim's machine is infected with a Banloader. A Banloader is a malware family used as a first stage of the infection chain. A Banload typically loads and executes additional payloads, such as Banking Trojans. This particular payload completes the second stage of the infection when the victim's IP address matches with a Brazilian IP range.

::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::
[+] Case Artifacts & Indicators
::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::

..::Network Artifacts::.

Banload Download URLs - OFFLINE
===========================
https://goo.gl/Dpq3ED (redirect)
http://myquinapauxcv.info/jOqRzYnP.php

Banload DLL Download URL - OFFLINE
===============================
http://54.39.13.241/info.php?id=0

Banload Command & Control
===================================
http://54.39.13.241/index.php
http://cxworkdxxxeo.loginto.me (69.162.68.69)

..::Email Artifacts::.

From: "sakata@mgsfoods.com.br" <sakata@mgsfoods.com.br>
To: "holandapaulo@bol.com.br" <holandapaulo@bol.com.br>
Subject: PDF.  Att: Flora Bela currículo 911570512 Data: 05/03/2018
Date: Mon, 5 Mar 2018 18:49:44 +0000
Originating IP: 191.252.30.149 (Brazil)

notes.note: The SOC has contacted the following authorities regarding this case: Web Hosting.
notes.author: wwilson

notes.note: The SOC has contacted the following authorities regarding this case: Network Provider.
notes.author: aray

data.title: Confirm TT Transfer Made On [2/20/2018]
data.description:
We are analyzing the Phishing Threat Monitoring Item number #79013 within this case.

Further updates will be posted within this case as they become available.



::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::
[+] Synopsis
::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::

We reviewed a suspicious email submitted for analysis by Universal Music Group. This email is an attempt to elicit a reply and collect information on the recipient allowing for the progression of a scam. The email mentions an attached document, but either the sender forgot to attach it, or it was stripped away by antivirus software. The email used in the attack, team@mint.com has been spoofed by the sender.

::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::
[+] Case Artifacts & Indicators
::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::

..::Email Artifacts::.

Sender IP Address
=====================
161.47.34.7

notes.note: The SOC has contacted the following authorities regarding this case: Telco.
notes.author: mkelley

This email is an attempt to elicit a reply and collect information on the recipient allowing for the progression of a 419 scam. The email mentions an attached document, but either the sender forgot to attach it, or it was stripped away by antivirus software. The email used in the attack, team@mint.com has been spoofed by the sender.
